intro: Otomeria elatior f. speciosa, commonly known as the showy otomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with prominent, showy bracts. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in humid tropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
